intro: Leptorumohra miqueliana, commonly known as the Miquel's leaved orchid, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pale pink. The plant has slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves that are arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories where it relies on specific mycorrhizal fungi for nutrient uptake.
